column4: Google accounts show 11 bln euros moved via low tax 'Dutch sandwich' in 2014
column5: AMSTERDAM/LONDON  Feb 19 Google moved 10.7 billion euros ($12 billion) through the Netherlands to Bermuda in 2014  as part of a structure which allows it to earn most of its foreign income tax free.

column4: UPDATE 1-Justice Dept. scrutinizes top U.S. airlines over mail cargo
column5: Feb 19 The U.S. Justice Department has started an investigation into whether top airlines have complied with contracts to carry mail cargo for the U.S. Postal Service  the three biggest U.S. passenger carriers said this week.

column4: UPDATE 3-Trump calls for boycott until Apple unlocks shooter's phone
column5: PAWLEYS ISLAND  S.C.  Feb 19 Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump called on Friday for a boycott of Apple Inc products until the tech company agreed to help the U.S. government unlock the cellphone of one of the killers in last year's San Bernardino  California  shooting.

column4: Exclusive: Common mobile software could have opened San Bernardino shooter's iPhone
column5: Feb 19 - The legal showdown over U.S. demands that Apple Inc AAPL.O unlock an iPhone used by San Bernardino shooter Rizwan Farook might have been avoided if his employer  which owns the device  had equipped it with special mobile phone software it issues to many workers.

column4: Hearing scheduled in Apple encryption case for March 22: U.S. Justice Dept
column5: WASHINGTON A federal court hearing in California has been scheduled for March 22 in a case involving the Justice Department's request that Apple help unlock the encrypted iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino killers  according to Thom Mrozek  a spokesman for the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Central District of California.

column5: LOS ANGELES  Feb 19 The U.S. Department of Justice has filed a motion seeking to compel Apple Inc  to comply with a judge's order for the company to unlock the iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino shooters  according to a court document filed Friday.

column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 19 The U.S. Department of Justice has filed motion seeking to compel Apple Inc to comply with a judge's order for the company to unlock the iPhone belonging to one of the San Bernardino shooters  ABC News reported on Friday.

column4: BlackRock upbeat on emerging currency debt for first time in 3 years
column5: LONDON  Feb 19 The world's biggest asset manager  BlackRock  has gone overweight emerging local currency bonds within its emerging market debt strategies for the first time in three years  predicting double-digit returns this year from the sector.

column5: BRUSSELS  Feb 19 Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd has offered concessions to allay antitrust concerns over its $40.5 billion bid for Allergan's  generics unit  European Union regulators said on Friday.

column4: Canada says finds possible Toyota vehicle defect after fatal crash
column5: TOKYO  Feb 19 Canada's transport ministry said it had found a potential seat-related defect in one of Toyota Motor Corp's popular models after a fatal crash that led to a global recall of nearly 3 million vehicles by the world's top-selling automaker.

column4: Delta  like United  received Justice Dept inquiry about mail - spokesman
column5: Feb 19 Delta Air Lines Inc received a civil investigative demand from the U.S. Justice Department last year about the mail it carries for the U.S. Postal Service  and it is fully cooperating with the request  a spokesman told Reuters on Friday.

column4: United Airlines receives U.S. Justice Dept civil inquiry about mail
column5: By Jeffery Dastin The U.S. Justice Department has asked United Continental Holdings Inc for documents and oral testimony related to its contract to carry mail for the U.S. Postal Service  the airline said in its annual regulatory filing on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 2-United Airlines receives U.S. Justice Dept civil inquiry about mail

column4: Big banks see the need to shrink – but face a path full of obstacles
column5: NEW YORK/LONDON When the U.S. Federal Reserve's newest policymaker Neel Kashkari dropped a bombshell with a call to break up big banks on Tuesday  it was met with a predictably indignant response from their lobbyists. One described his comments as "blind."     But while no one in the executive suites of major global banks would want authorities to force them to split up or downsize  many top bankers acknowledge that their institutions might be better off smaller and simpler. column5: Feb 19 Cheniere Energy Inc ex-Chief Executive Charif Souki has resigned from the company's board  according to a regulatory filing.
